response: "I feel like I have to be flawless in every aspect of my life, but it's overwhelming me."
"I keep comparing myself to others, and I can't help but feel like I'm never good enough."
"I'm constantly striving for perfection, but I'm beginning to realize it's an impossible standard."
"I feel like I'm losing touch with reality trying to meet society's expectations of perfection."
"I don't know who I am anymore; I'm just trying to be this ideal version of myself that doesn't even exist."
"Every time I make a mistake, I spiral into self-doubt and self-criticism because I feel like I have to be flawless."
"I'm starting to question if this pressure to be perfect is even worth it, but I don't know how to let it go."
"I feel like I'm trapped in a cycle of trying to meet society's standards, but I can't keep up anymore."
"I wish I could just be myself without worrying about being judged for not being perfect."
"I'm beginning to realize that chasing perfection is driving me crazy, but I don't know how to break free from it."
